title: How to Make Laksan (Mackerel in Spicy Coconut)

steps.headline: Mix the mackerel with sago flour, salt, and water.
Knead until the dough can be formed into a ball and your hands are no longer sticky.
Divide the dough into six parts.
Heat the water until it is boiling.
steps.description: Add a few drops of oil to the water, then the dough balls. Cook until the dough pieces float.

steps.headline: Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside to drain.
Heat oil in the pan.
steps.description: Saute the ground spices until fragrant and cooked.

steps.headline: Add the coconut milk and water.
steps.description: Cook until boiling, stirring so that coconut milk is not separated.

steps.headline: Cut the laksan into pieces.
steps.description: Put the pieces into a serving bowl, then pour the coconut milk mixture over the top.

steps.headline: Serve with a sprinkling of fried onions.

text: Preparing the fish Mix the mackerel with sago flour, salt, and water.  Knead until the dough can be formed into a ball and your hands are no longer sticky.  Divide the dough into six parts. Shape into oval balls. Heat the water until it is boiling. Add a few drops of oil to the water, then the dough balls. Cook until the dough pieces float. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside to drain. These are now the laksan. Making the gravy Heat oil in the pan. Saute the ground spices until fragrant and cooked. Add the coconut milk and water. Cook until boiling, stirring so that coconut milk is not separated. Cut the laksan into pieces. Put the pieces into a serving bowl, then pour the coconut milk mixture over the top. Serve with a sprinkling of fried onions.
